news_header: Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Group, passed away at 86, leaving a significant legacy in business and philanthropy.
news_text: Ratan Tata, the former chairman of Tata Group, died at the age of 86. His contributions greatly influenced both the company and India as a whole. Tata, who was undergoing routine medical examinations prior to his death, was remembered as a visionary leader by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and others in the business community. Born in 1937 in Mumbai, Tata joined the family business in 1962 after studying architecture at Cornell University. He became chairman in 1991, guiding the company through significant expansions and acquisitions, including the purchase of Tetley, Corus, and Jaguar Land Rover. Tata was instrumental in diversifying the group into a global conglomerate with over 30 companies and a revenue of $165 billion in 2023-24. After stepping down in 2012, he focused on philanthropy and supporting startups. He received prestigious awards such as the Padma Bhushan and Padma Vibhushan.
